subject: Technology
title: The Super Bowl: TV's Biggest Stage
description: One-minute skill: The Super Bowl: TV's Biggest Stage.

hook.text: The Super Bowl is watched more for its commercials than its game. A 30-second ad costs $7 million.

buildup.text: Over 100 million Americans watch the Super Bowl annually. It's the last truly shared live TV experience in a fragmented world.

discovery.text: Apple's 1984 commercial during the Super Bowl launched the Macintosh and created the concept of the event commercial.

twist.text: Companies now release their Super Bowl ads online before the game. The commercial break became content people seek out.

climax.text: The Super Bowl proves that in a streaming world, live events still command massive audiences willing to watch together.

punchline.text: The Super Bowl is the last campfire where America gathers around one screen.
